TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit HtmlImage extends System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl

Docs.summary: Provides programmatic access for the HTML element on the server.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this control to display an image on a Web page. The HtmlImage control can be programmatically manipulated to change the image displayed, the image size, and the alignment of the image relative to other page elements.
For a list of initial property values for an instance of HtmlImage, see the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to programmatically modify the properties of an HtmlImage control when an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlButton> is clicked.
[!code-vb[Classic HtmlImage Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.htmlcont_15_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic HtmlImage Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.htmlcont_15_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this constructor to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage> class.
The following table shows the initial property value for an instance of <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage>.
|Property|Initial Value| |--------------|-------------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlControl.TagName%2A>|The "img" literal string.|
## Examples The following code example illustrates how to create and initialize a new instance of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage> control.
[!code-vb[HtmlImageCtor#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/m-system.web.ui.htmlcont_0_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[HtmlImageCtor#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/m-system.web.ui.htmlcont_0_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the alignment of the image relative to other Web page elements.
Docs.value: A string that specifies the alignment of the image relative to other Web page elements.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to specify the alignment of the image with respect to other elements on the Web page. The following table represents the possible values. |Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |left|The image is aligned on the left side of the Web page.| |center|The image is aligned in the center of the Web page.| |right|The image is aligned on the right side of the Web page.| |top|Other elements in the Web page are aligned with the top edge of the image.| |middle|Other elements in the Web page are aligned with the middle of the image.| |bottom|Other elements in the Web page are aligned with the bottom edge of the image.| > [!NOTE] > The center value might not work on all browsers. To center an image, wrap the control inside paragraph tags that contain the `align` attribute set to `"center"` (`

`). ## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Align property to specify the alignment of an image on a Web page. [!code-vb[Classic HtmlImage.Align Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.htmlcont_18_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic HtmlImage.Align Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.htmlcont_18_1.aspx)] The following code example demonstrates how to center an image on the Web page by wrapping the control inside paragraph tags with the `align` attribute set to `"center"`. [!code-cs[Classic HtmlImage.Align Example#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.htmlcont_18_2.aspx)] [!code-vb[Classic HtmlImage.Align Example#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.htmlcont_18_2.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the alternative caption the browser displays if an image is unavailable or currently downloading and not yet finished.
Docs.value: A string that contains the alternative caption for the browser to use when the image is unavailable.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to specify the caption displayed when the image specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage.Src%2A> property is unavailable. On newer browsers, this caption also appears as a ToolTip.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Alt property to specify the caption to display when the image specified by the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage.Src%2A> property is unavailable.
[!code-cs[Classic HtmlImage.Border Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.htmlcont_11_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[Classic HtmlImage.Border Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.htmlcont_11_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the width of a frame for an image.
Docs.value: The width (in pixels) of a frame for an image.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use this property to create a frame with the specified width (in pixels) for an image.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Border property to specify a frame with a width of 5 pixels for an <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage> control.
[!code-cs[Classic HtmlImage.Border Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.htmlcont_96_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[Classic HtmlImage.Border Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.htmlcont_96_1.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the height of the image.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Height and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage.Width%2A> properties can be used two ways. You can use the Height and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage.Width%2A> properties to send image size specifications to the browser. This displays the Web page faster because the browser does not need to recalculate the positions of elements on the page when the image loads.
You can also use the Height and <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage.Width%2A> properties to scale the image. When using values different from the physical size of the image, the image is resized accordingly. However, this method for scaling the image is not recommended because it takes longer for the page to display it. Instead, physically resize the image to the size you need.
By default, the Height property is expressed in pixels, but it can also be expressed as a percentage of the size of the window.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Height property to programmatically modify the height of the displayed image.
[!code-vb[Classic HtmlImage.Height Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.htmlcont_12_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic HtmlImage.Height Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.htmlcont_12_1.aspx)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig virtual instance void RenderAttributes(class System.Web.UI.HtmlTextWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: The that contains the output stream to render on the client.
Docs.summary: Renders the control's attributes to the specified object.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If the value of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage.Src%2A> property is a malformed URL, the RenderAttributes method throws an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> exception.
The RenderAttributes method overrides the base class's RenderAttributes method to write the `src` attribute of the rendered <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage> control.
The RenderAttributes method is used primarily by control developers extending the functionality of the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage> control.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to override the RenderAttributes method in a custom server control so that specific alternative text, accessible as a ToolTip, is always displayed with the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage> control.
[!code-cs[CustomHtmlImageRenderAttributes#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/beb28d97-6e8a-4a11-a57b-_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[CustomHtmlImageRenderAttributes#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/beb28d97-6e8a-4a11-a57b-_1.aspx)]
[!code-vb[CustomHtmlImageRenderAttributes#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/beb28d97-6e8a-4a11-a57b-_2.vb)] [!code-cs[CustomHtmlImageRenderAttributes#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/beb28d97-6e8a-4a11-a57b-_2.cs)]

Docs.exception: The property contains a malformed URL.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the source of the image file to display.
Docs.value: A string that contains the path to an image file to display.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use this property to specify the path to the image file to display. If the image file is in the same directory as the Web page source file that uses it, you can just specify the file name. Otherwise, you must also include the path to the file. The path can be absolute or relative to the directory that contains the Web page source file. You can use the relative path " `~/` " to refer to the current virtual directory where the page is located. For example, the value of Src for `` on a page in the "XspTest" virtual directory is ``. ## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Src property to specify an image file to display in the same directory as the Web page source file. [!code-cs[Classic HtmlImage.Src Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.htmlcont_90_1.aspx)] [!code-vb[Classic HtmlImage.Src Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.htmlcont_90_1.aspx)] The following code example demonstrates how to use the Src property to specify an image file to display in a different directory from the Web page source file. [!code-cs[Classic HtmlImage.Src Example#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.htmlcont_90_2.aspx)] [!code-vb[Classic HtmlImage.Src Example#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.htmlcont_90_2.aspx)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the width of the image.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage.Height%2A> and Width properties can be used two ways. You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage.Height%2A> and Width properties to send the image size specifications to the browser. This displays the Web page faster because the browser does not need to recalculate the positions of elements on the page when the image loads.
You can also use the <xref:System.Web.UI.HtmlControls.HtmlImage.Height%2A> and Width properties to scale the image. When using values that are different from the physical size of the image, the image is resized accordingly. However, this method for scaling the image is not recommended because it takes longer for the page to display it. Instead, physically resize the image to the size you need.
By default, the Width property is expressed in pixels, but it can also be expressed as a percentage of the window size.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Width property to programmatically modify the width of the displayed image.
[!code-vb[Classic HtmlImage.Height Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.web.ui.htmlcont_43_1.aspx)] [!code-cs[Classic HtmlImage.Height Example#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.web.ui.htmlcont_43_1.aspx)]
